function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Analysis of bioindicators in wastewater to estimate population can lead to inaccurate assessments and decision-making.","Impact":"Mismanagement of resources and public health interventions based on inaccurate population estimates.","Mitigation":"Use multiple methods to estimate population in a catchment area to cross-verify results and improve accuracy.","Technologies":"Statistical analysis tools, data modeling, and cross-referencing with other demographic data sources.","People":"Public health authorities, environmental agencies, researchers, and policymakers.","Owner":"Public health authorities, environmental agencies, research institutions, and local government."},{"Description":"Testing sample materials during a pandemic carries the risk of incomplete or inaccurate detection of contagious viruses such as SARS-CoV-2.","Impact":"Failure to detect hotspots and limit virus transmission, leading to increased public health risks.","Mitigation":"Use of multiple, validated testing methods and comprehensive sample collection strategies.","Technologies":"PCR assays specific to different genes of the virus, standardized testing protocols, and quality control measures.","People":"Health authorities, researchers, and laboratory technicians conducting the testing.","Owner":"Health authorities, research institutions, and testing laboratories."},{"Description":"Reliance on PCR assays targeting specific genes for SARS-CoV-2 detection in wastewater may result in limited virus detection and surveillance.","Impact":"Underestimation of virus prevalence and transmission, leading to inadequate public health interventions.","Mitigation":"Utilize a combination of gene-specific and comprehensive viral detection methods to ensure accurate surveillance.","Technologies":"PCR assays targeting multiple genes, next-generation sequencing, and advanced viral detection technologies.","People":"Public health authorities, environmental agencies, researchers, and laboratory technicians.","Owner":"Public health authorities, environmental agencies, research institutions, and testing laboratories."}]}
